text: Joyeux is a commune in the Ain department in eastern France. ==Geography== Joyeux lies less than from the wildlife park at Villars-les-Dombes and from Lyon in the natural region of the Dombes, a wide extent of middle and upper Pleistocene moraine left near the margin of the Alpine ice sheets. The commune includes some thirty lakes which together represent some 4 square kilometres of water. The land between them is of gravel, sand and clay. ==History== The fief of Joyeux was mentioned in the twelfth century. In the fifteenth century, it was in the possession of the Villars family. On 13 February 2006, a wild duck was found dead on the fen. It was the first attested case of the presence of the bird flu virus H5N1 in France. ==Administration== {| class="wikitable" |+ List of the mayors |- ! Period !! Name !! Party !!
